thread.title_full: “MARY TYLER MOORE: A CELEBRATION” (8 P.M., PBS): She turned the world on with her smile.

title: “MARY TYLER MOORE: A CELEBRATION” (8 P.M., PBS): She turned the world on with her smile.
text:
Tweet Published: Tue, October 13, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
“MARY TYLER MOORE: A CELEBRATION” (8 P.M., PBS): She turned the world on with her smile. Now, “Mary Tyler Moore: A Celebration” delivers a heartfelt tribute to the TV legend. Among those interviewed: Oprah Winfrey, Tina Fey, Betty White, Ed Asner, Dick Van Dyke, Valerie Harper and more. 
“Secrets of the Dead” (9 p.m., PBS): Historians seek the truth about the Trojan horse. 
“Manhattan” (9 p.m., WGN America): Season 2 begins. 
“Chicago Fire” (10 p.m., NBC): Where’s the fire? Back for a fourth season, that’s where. 
TV LISTINGS, B6 
Film group seeks donations for trip 
YOUNGSTOWN 
The Youngstown Regional Film Commission is raising money to send representatives to the American Film Market in Santa Monica, Calif., in November. The commission will market the Mahoning Valley at the event in an effort to lure filmmakers here. 
To donate, go to filmyoungstown.com. All who donate at least $50 will be eligible in a contest to win an airplane ride over your hometown in a water plane. The flight also will be filmed from the plane and a copy will be given to the winner. 
Photographer to speak at YSU 
Youngstown 
Contemporary photographer David Hilliard will give a free presentation at 4 p.m. Thursday in the McDonough Museum of Art at Youngstown State University. The public is welcome. For information, call 330-941-2307. 
Known for his panoramic photographs documenting his life and the lives of those around him, Hilliard’s work strikes a balance between autobiography and fiction. Other stories of interest
